smMP7.name: MP7
smMP7.desc: Another contender for the newly developing PDW market the MP7 is currently in service with the German Bundeswehr and the Norwegian Armed Forces. The MP7A1 includes an improved stock, additional safeties, and added rails for mounting lights, lasers, and sights. The weapon is also capable of being suppressed, giving it excellent close combat stealth performance.

pG17.name: G17C
pG17.desc: The G17C pistol is part of a large series of pistols from an Austrian manufacturer. Chambered in 9mm, this full sized combat pistol features a polymer frame and anti-corrosion surfaces that make it incredibly reliable. The G17C is incredibly popular with both Police and Military units worldwide. This G17C has been equipped with an integral Laser Sight that makes unaimed fire more accurate.

srM98.name: M98B
srM98.desc: A precision tactical rifle, the M98B was uniquely developed from the ground up as a Bolt-Action Sniper Rifle. Firing the .338 Magnum round from a detachable box magazine the M98B is capable of impressive accuracy and great stopping power even at extreme ranges. The M98B is currently being evaluated by US SOCOM in a modified form. The M98B is equipped with a Rifle Scope (8x).

caSG553.name: SG553
caSG553.desc: A Carbine variant of the Swiss Armyʹs standard SG550 rifle, the SG553 improves over its predecessor the well-known SG552 by including integrated rails for mounting accessories. A Carbine with excellent ergonomics, the SG553 is capable of Automatic, 3 Round Burst, and Semi-Automatic fire and is an excellent close range weapon.

sg870.name: 870MCS
sg870.desc: The M870 is an American made Pump-Action Shotgun that has been used by Special Forces units for decades. In urban environments the M870 is especially effective due to its high stopping power at close range. The ability to load different types of shells makes the M870 able to adapt to a wide variety of situations, while a narrow choke gives the M870 slightly more range than other shotguns.

pMP443S.name: MP443 SUPP.
pMP443S.desc: Designed to replace the dated PMM pistol, the MP443 Grach pistol was developed in 1993 and fires high powered armor-piercing 9mm Russian rounds. The pistol is a combined construction of polymers and steel and has been adopted by select Special Forces units in the Russian military. This MP443 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

wLATRPG.name: RPG-7V2
wLATRPG.desc: A widely-produced, anti-tank rocket propelled grenade weapon, the RPG-7 has been used in almost all conflicts across all continents since the mid-1960s.  Modernized into the RPG-7v2, which is lighter, and more accurate than the original RPG-7 and firing GP-7VL rocket propelled grenades the RPG-7v2 is effective against both fortifications and armor.

caMTAR21.name: MTAR-21
caMTAR21.desc: This bullpup carbine is the ultra-compact version of the Israeli army standard TAR-21 rifle. It features supreme ergonomics and handling due to its 590 mm (23.2 in) length and is intended for use in tighter environments where standard length rifles become cumbersome. As of 2009, it is destined to become the standard rifle of the IDF, and is also seeing success internationally as part of security and police forces.

arKH.name: KH2002
arKH.desc: This Iranian developed Assault Rifle is essentially a bullpup conversion of the M16. The KH2002 is intended to replace the G3 in service with the Iranian armed forces, though there is speculation that it may be years before the rifle is ready for full deployment. The KH2002ʹs short length lends itself well to close combat, but prevents it from mounting any underslung weapons.

caAKS.name: AKS-74u
caAKS.desc: Derived from the AKS-74, the AKS-74u is a shortened Carbine with the power of a rifle cartridge but the size of a submachine gun. Often called by its nickname “Krinkov” the shortened barrel makes the weapon inaccurate at medium ranges but extremely effective in close quarters. Due to its incredibly short length the AKS-74U cannot mount a bipod.

wasXBS.name: XBOW SCOPED
wasXBS.desc: The Xbow fires a variety of different bolts.

unlocks.name: SCAN BOLT
unlocks.nname: It is ok to thank me

pM1911S.name: M1911 SUPP.
pM1911S.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces. This M1911 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

mgM27.name: M27 IAR
mgM27.desc: This beefed up M416 entered service alongside the M249 in the Marine Corps in 2011. The M27 Infantry Automatic Rifle (IAR) features a heavier, longer barrel and an extended magazine to enable greater amounts of suppressive fire while retaining some of the mobility of a standard M416. The M27 features a bipod by default for supported shooting.

caG36.name: G36C
caG36.desc: A cut down version of the German Armyʹs full size G36 rifle, the C in G36C is stands for Commando or Compact. Equipped with a number of rails for accessories and a set of backup iron sights instead of the integrated optics and carry handle of the G36, the G36C is a Carbine with significant customization options. Its great ergonomics and short length make it excellent in short range encounters. The G36C also includes a 2 Round Burst mode.

pTaur.name: .44 MAGNUM
pTaur.desc: A .44 Magnum, the most powerful handgun in the world, this particular model features a ported barrel, a compact frame for easy carry, and of course, a round that will blow your head clean off. The .44 Magnum is the most powerful available side arm, but the recoil and weight of the weapon makes fast follow up shots extremely difficult.

smVAL.name: AS VAL
smVAL.desc: The AS VAL is an integrally suppressed Soviet designed Assault Rifle developed for use in the Spetsnaz. Chambered for a special high performance armor piercing 9x39mm round, the AS VAL includes mounts for using optical, red dot or even night vision scopes. The VAL is designed to be fired only with the suppressor attached, and therefore prevents the rifle from mounting underslung attachments.

sgDAO.name: DAO-12
sgDAO.desc: A Battlefield 2 classic, originally developed in South Africa, the DAO-12 is essentially the combination of a revolver and a Shotgun. The fixed drum magazine is made of individual chambers, each holding a single round, which are fired only when placed in line with the barrel. A spring winding mechanism makes reloading an empty weapon a time consuming process and the short barrel results in a wide pellet spread.

wahUGL.name: M320
wahUGL.desc: A single shot 40mm Grenade Launcher, the M320 replaced the old M203 in service with the US Military.  Initially developed for the G36 assault rifle, the M320 allows a larger variety of ammunition to be used with the weapon including Fragmentation, Flechette, Smoke rounds and Low Velocity Grenades. The M320 can be equipped on some Assault Rifles with the Underslung Rail.

smUMP.name: UMP-45
smUMP.desc: German built, the UMP-45 is a fully automatic Personal Defense Weapon noted for its versatility and optimal mobility. Essentially an improved version of the MP5, the UMP-45 is functionally similar but substantially cheaper to manufacture and includes several modern upgrades such as the top and forward accessory rail. The UMP-45 is well-rounded and capable as a Personal Defense Weapon.

wLAAIGL.name: SA-18 IGLA
wLAAIGL.desc: Russian man-portable infrared homing SAM. Labeled the 9K38 by the Russians and SA-18 IGLA by the US, the IGLA is capable of engaging a wide range of threats from UAV sized aircraft up to helicopters and low flying jets.  The IGLA requires a locked target in order to fire.

caSCAR.name: SCAR-H
caSCAR.desc: Developed for the US SOCOM, the SCAR is a modular series of weapons available in multiple interchangeable calibers, barrel lengths, and configurations. This particular model has been configured as a SCAR-H CQB (SCAR-Heavy Close Quarters Battle) with a shortened barrel and chambered for the hard hitting 7.62mm NATO round. This gives the SCAR-H a greater range than typical Carbines at the expense of serious recoil.

pM412.name: MP412 REX
pM412.desc: Developed for export in Russia (REX stands for Revolver for Export), the MP412 is a compact .357 Magnum handgun with an interesting tilt open and auto extraction design. While not as powerful as the .44 Magnum, the .357 Magnum round from the MP412 offers excellent stopping power and the compact package offers a slightly higher rate of accurate fire.

arM416.name: M416
arM416.desc: The M416 was developed by a famous German weapons manufacturer as a more reliable version of the classic M16. The weapon is essentially a fusion of the M16 and the G36 Assault Rifles. The M416 is reliable and accurate, with a moderate recoil and rate of fire that makes for an effective all around weapon.

mgPech.name: PKP PECHENEG
mgPech.desc: Another Modernization of a traditional Russian weapon, the PKP Pecheneg replaces the PKM machine gun in service with Spetsnaz units. Firing a heavier round than the RPK-74M the Pecheneg is able to supply greater suppressive fire thanks to its increased power and belt feed. The Pecheneg comes equipped by default with a bipod for supported shooting.

mgM60.name: M60E4
mgM60.desc: “The Pig,” as it was commonly referred to when it was introduced in Vietnam, has served with every branch of the US Military and continues to serve with Special Forces groups. All though the M60 has been mostly replaced by the M240, the upgraded M60E4 features modern accessory rails, a shortened barrel, and improved reliability, and reduced weight. The M60E4 features a bipod standard for supported shooting.

mgM240.name: M240B
mgM240.desc: The M240 is a General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG) that was first developed in Belgium and adopted by the USMC in 1991. The M60 was replaced first by the M240G, and subsequently by the M240B which provides commonality between the Marines and the US Army. Firing the heavier 7.62mm NATO round the M240B has greater power than the M249. The M240 is equipped with a bipod by default for supported shooting.

pM1911L.name: M1911 TACT.
pM1911L.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces. This M1911 has been equipped with a Tactical Light that can be blinding in close quarters.

smPP2000.name: PP-2000
smPP2000.desc: Though chambered in the standard 9x19mm caliber, the PP-2000 is designed to use Russian overpressure rounds at high velocity to penetrate body armor. The high muzzle velocity of the PP-2000 gives it a flatter trajectory than other 9mm weapons, and its compact size make it ideal as a Personal Defense Weapon. When equipped with the 40 round extended magazine the PP-2000 also functions admirably in a CQB assault role.

arG3.name: G3A3
arG3.desc: The G3 rifle is one of the most widely fielded Assault Rifles in the world. Multiple versions of the G3 exist, and it has been used in countries around the world, including Sweden where it was known as the AK4. This particular G3 is the A3 variant, with a fixed stock. The long barrel and firing heavy 7.62x51mm NATO round enable the G3A3 to reach out at longer ranges than most other Assault Rifles, but at the cost of heavy recoil.

arAEK.name: AEK-971
arAEK.desc: The AEK-971 was developed as a possible successor to the AK-74 series of Assault Rifles and features a unique recoil reduction system. The AEK-971ʹs high rate of fire makes it excellent in close quarters but difficult to control. Shooters should switch to Semi-Automatic or 3 Round Burst for longer ranges.

arAUG.name: AUG A3
arAUG.desc: This 5.56 bullpup design was developed in the 1970s and features high modularity while being fully ambidextrous. Since its adoption as the standard rifle of the Austrian army in 1977, it has seen great success as an export, with a high number of global users praising its ruggedness and excellent handling.

arAN94.name: AN-94
arAN94.desc: In service with elite Russian forces, the AN-94 offers a unique, highly accurate, 2 round burst feature. Compared to the standard AK series, the AN-94 requires a significantly higher degree of training. A skilled shooter can effectively engage targets at a longer range than typical Assault Rifles.

sgSPAS12.name: SPAS-12
sgSPAS12.desc: This Italian made iconic shotgun has seen great success since its introduction on the market during the 1980s. Itʹs become popular world wide thanks to its capacity to handle a great variety  of shell types. Its unique magazine design further simplifies the use of varied ammunition, allowing the SPAS-12 to remain in high regard with police and military units worldwide.

pTaurS.name: .44 SCOPED
pTaurS.desc: A .44 Magnum, the most powerful handgun in the world, this particular model features a ported barrel, a compact frame for easy carry, and of course, a round that will blow your head clean off. The .44 Magnum is the most powerful available side arm, but the recoil and weight of the weapon makes fast follow up shots extremely difficult. This .44Magnum is equipped with a 3x scope.

sgUSAS.name: USAS-12
sgUSAS.desc: A South Korean produced Automatic Shotgun, the USAS-12 was specifically developed for the combat Shotgun role. Feeding from a box magazine, and capable of both Automatic and Semi-Automatic fire, the USAS-12ʹs high weight makes recoil manageable. The open choke results in a wide pellet spread.

pMP443.name: MP443
pMP443.desc: Designed to replace the dated PMM pistol, the MP443 Grach pistol was developed in 1993 and fires high powered armor-piercing 9mm Russian rounds. The pistol is a combined construction of polymers and steel and has been adopted by select Special Forces units in the Russian military.

arAK74.name: AK-74M
arAK74.desc: The AK-74M is the latest Modernized version of the classic AK-47. Fielded as the standard Assault Rifle by the Russian Army, the M variant includes a side folding polymer stock and a scope mount rail on the left side of the weapon. Recent developments allow the AK series of weapons to field many of the accessories typically seen on Western guns. The AK-74M is a reliable and rugged medium range weapon.

arL85A2.name: L85A2
arL85A2.desc: Part of the SA80 family, the L85 is the standard assault rifle of the British armed forces.

srSV98.name: SV98
srSV98.desc: Similar to its Western counter parts, the SV-98 began life as a proven Bolt-Action sporting rifle. The SV-98 is equipped with a 10 round detachable box magazine, a muzzle brake that can be swapped for a suppressor, and backup iron sights. The SV-98 is standardly equipped with a PKS-07 (7x) for very long range shooting.

srM40.name: M40A5
srM40.desc: Developed around the Bolt-Action of a proven American hunting rifle, the M40A5 has been upgraded with a lightened fiberglass stock, a detachable magazine, and the provisions for mounting suppressors. An incredibly accurate rifle, the M40A5 currently serves as the primary Sniper Rifle for the USMC. The M40A5 is by default equipped with a Rifle Scope (8x).

arSCARL.name: SCAR-L
arSCARL.desc: The SCAR rifle systemʹs modularity allows for many different configurations. The Mk. 16 “SCAR-L” features a 14 inch barrel as well as a full 30 round magazine. Compared to its 20 round carbine counterpart, the heavier Mk. 17, the SCAR-L provides greater target acquisition at longer ranges due to the extended barrel length as well as more controlled fire due to manageable recoil.

caACR.name: ACW-R
caACR.desc: This adaptive combat rifle features a number of recent rifle designs and acts as a lightweight, feature heavy, rifle platform. Using the modern, recoil-reducing “Grendel” round, as well as being built to endure rough weather conditions and capable of utilizing standard STANAG magazines, this rifle is equipped to fill many of the roles required by both military and law enforcement uses.

mgMG36.name: MG36
mgMG36.desc: Machine gun version of the German G36. This MG model is no longer in production.

sgSaiga.name: SAIGA 12K
sgSaiga.desc: This Russian made magazine fed 12 gauge Shotgun is based on the proven AK-47 action and equipped with a folding stock. It is reliable, fast to reload, and capable of mounting a variety of accessories. The Saiga 12K is popular with Russian police and security services, and it is an effective close combat weapon with a wide pellet spread.

arFAMAS.name: FAMAS
arFAMAS.desc: Standard service rifle of the French military.

pM1911T.name: M1911 S-TAC
pM1911T.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces. This M1911 has been equipped with a Tactical Light and a Suppressor.

pM9S.name: M9 SUPP.
pM9S.desc: Formally known as Pistol, Semiautomatic, 9mm, M9, the M9 was selected as the primary sidearm of the entire United States military in 1985. Developed in Italy, the M9 was selected in a series of often disputed trials, only narrowly beating out other contenders, because of its high quality and low price. This M9 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

mgRPK.name: RPK-74M
mgRPK.desc: The RPK-74M is an improved version of the original RPK developed in the 1950s. Essentially a heavy barreled AK-74, the RPK fires from a longer magazine and has been equipped with polymer grips to lighten the weapon. The RPK-74M also features the same scope mount as the AK-74M and is equipped with a bipod by default for supported shooting.

arM16.name: M16A3
arM16.desc: The 3rd generation of M16A3 has been upgraded with a RIS (Rail Interface System) for mounting accessories and is capable of Automatic and Semi-Automatic fire. Available to front line units engaged in urban combat, the M16A3ʹs low recoil makes a capable all around weapon.

pM1911.name: M1911
pM1911.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces.

pM93R.name: 93R
pM93R.desc: A modified version of the M9 pistol, the 93R is able to fire in 3 Round Bursts. The 93R is equipped with a forward folding fore grip and an extended barrel which is ported to reduce recoil. Trained shooters are able to fire busts in rapid succession, and the pistol is typically seen in service only with elite special purpose units.

srSVD.name: SVD
srSVD.desc: Designed as a squad support weapon, the SVD Dragunov enhances a squadʹs ability by providing long range, rapid, accurate Semi-Automatic fire. Although the SVD looks similar to an AK style weapon, these are merely cosmetic. When paired with specially designed sniper cartridges the SVD Dragunov is a deadly and accurate marksman weapon. The SVD is equipped with a standard PKS-07 (7x) scope.

sgJackH.name: MK3A1
sgJackH.desc: Fully automatic shotgun prototype developed in the US.

pg18S.name: G18 SUPP.
pg18S.desc: Essentially an Automatic version of the G17C, the G18 was developed for the Austrian EKO Cobra counter-terrorist force. Classified as a Machine Pistol, the G18 has been equipped with a number of modifications to allow greater control over its very rapid fire. Regardless, the G18 in Automatic is incredibly difficult to fire effectively at anything other than extremely short ranges. This G18 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

mgM249.name: M249
mgM249.desc: An adapted version of the Belgian original, the M249 was modified to conform to the United Statesʹ design requirements. The M249 has seen action in every major conflict since the 1989 invasion of Panama and has earned a reputation as a reliable weapon. A single M249 can supply suppressive fire equivalent to 15 riflemen. The M249 comes equipped by default with a Bipod for supported shooting.

pG17S.name: G17C SUPP.
pG17S.desc: The G17C pistol is part of a large series of pistols from an Austrian manufacturer. Chambered in 9mm, this full sized combat pistol features a polymer frame and anti-corrosion surfaces that make it incredibly reliable. The G17C is incredibly popular with both Police and Military units worldwide. This G17C has been equipped with an integral Laser Sight that makes unaimed fire more accurate and a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

srQBU88.name: QBU-88
srQBU88.desc: Semi-automatic sniper rifle of Chinese design

pM9.name: M9
pM9.desc: Formally known as Pistol, Semiautomatic, 9mm, M9, the M9 was selected as the primary sidearm of the entire United States military in 1985. Developed in Italy, the M9 was selected in a series of often disputed trials, only narrowly beating out other contenders, because of its high quality and low price. The M9 is the primary sidearm of the USMC.

caM4.name: M4A1
caM4.desc: Essentially a shortened version of the M16 the M4A1 Carbine traces its roots to weapons designed for US Special Operations Command (SOCOM) during the Vietnam War. The M4A1 variant is capable of Automatic fire and includes rails that allow the user to equip a large number of accessories. The carbine has seen heavy use at the frontlines of Iraq and Afghanistan in close quarters and urban environments.

wasXBK.name: XBOW
wasXBK.desc: The Xbow fires a variety of different bolts.

unlocks.name: SCAN BOLT
unlocks.nname: It is ok to thank me

wahUSG.name: M26 MASS
wahUSG.desc: The M26 Lightweight Shotgun System was developed to replace older, more cumbersome breaching shotguns.  Available as a standalone shotgun, or capable of being mounted on some Assault Rifles with Underslung Rails, the M26 is able to fire Shot, Flechette, Frag, and Slug rounds.

srJNG90.name: JNG-90
srJNG90.desc: Easily identified by its massive muzzle break, the JNG-90 serves as the standard sniper rifle of the Turkish army. This modern rifle has integral rail systems and many other accessory options, making it adaptable to shifting situations. It provides the shooter great stopping power, as well as sub MOA accuracy.

mgL86A1.name: L86A2
mgL86A1.desc: Designed to provide fire support to smaller groups of infantry, this British SA80 family rifle comes equipped with an extended barrel giving great effective range. While originally intended to act as a light machine gun, it has seen a shift towards marksman duties due to its great performance at longer distances. While it has limited sustained fire capabilities due to not being belt fed, the reliable accuracy makes it a great force multiplier for any squad.

mgLSAT.name: LSAT
mgLSAT.desc: This US JSSAP prototype is intended to significantly reduce the weight associated with small arms and their ammunition. Using a High Ignition Temperature Propellant, this prototype light machine gun features belt fed caseless ammunition. Should the program be successful, this weapon system could become a great improvement over the heavier and more cumbersome squad automatic weapons currently in use.

wLATSMAW.name: SMAW
wLATSMAW.desc: Developed especially for the US Marine Corps to defeat light armor and enemy bunkers, the Mark 153 SMAW is capable of defeating both modern armor and emplacements.  83mm unguided rockets are loaded individually at the back of the launcher from disposable sealed 1 time use units.at the rear.

smP90.name: P90
smP90.desc: Developed in Belgium as a Personal Defense Weapon for vehicle crews, Special Forces and Counter-Terrorist groups the P90 is a compact and capable weapon system. The three forward rails allow an operator to mount a wide variety accessories and the 5.7x28mm special armor piercing ammunition is fired at nearly rifle velocity. Standard with a 50 round magazine the P90 is capable as an offensive CQB weapon for highly mobile personnel.

srHK417.name: M417
srHK417.desc: This bigger brother of M416 features a heavier 16 inch barrel as well as an enlarged receiver capable of handling the heavy 7.62 round. The high precision and stopping power of this rifle makes it ideal as a DMR, and it sees service in many armed forces worldwide.

caA91.name: A-91
caA91.desc: An unusual weapon, even by Russian standards, the A-91 is a bullpup Carbine chambered in the 5.56mm NATO round instead of a Russian caliber. Made from polymers, it features a forward shell ejection system that keeps shells well clear of the shooterʹs face upon ejection. The bullpup configuration prevents the A-91 from mounting a foregrip.

srMK11.name: MK11 MOD 0
srMK11.desc: Essentially an M16 chambered for the heavy 7.62mm NATO caliber the Mk 11 Mod 0 features a longer, heavier, free-floating barrel, enhanced rail system and provisions to mount a sound suppressor. Everything about the Mk 11 Mod 0 is designed to enhance accuracy and provide a squad long range, accurate, Semi-Automatic fire. The Mk 11 Mod 0 is equipped with a Rifle Scope (8x) by default.

srSKS.name: SKS
srSKS.desc: Millions of SKS rifles were produced originally for the Soviet Army in 1945 and in China as the Type 56. The SKS is a popular rifle with civilian shooters, and can still be found in a number of arsenals around the world. A number of aftermarket upgrades are available for the SKS, this model is equipped with a synthetic stock, detachable 30 round magazine, and a PKS-07 (7x) scope.

srL96.name: L96
srL96.desc: British made, high performance sniper rifle. Widely used across Europe.

smPP19.name: PP-19
smPP19.desc: Submachine gun developed in Russia, featuring a helical high capacity magazine.

mgT88.name: TYPE 88 LMG
mgT88.desc: A Chinese General Purpose Machine Gun the TYPE-88 is also known by its Chinese designation QJY-88. Despite the TYPE-88 name (referring to 1988 as the year of adoption) the weapon has only recently entered wide service with the Peopleʹs Liberation Army. The TYPE-88 fires a special heavy version of the Chinese 5.8x42mm round and is equipped by default with a bipod for supported shooting.

caQBZ95B.name: QBZ-95B
caQBZ95B.desc: Standard service rifle of the Chinese armed forces.

pM9F.name: M9 TACT.
pM9F.desc: Formally known as Pistol, Semiautomatic, 9mm, M9, the M9 was selected as the primary sidearm of the entire United States military in 1985. Developed in Italy, the M9 was selected in a series of often disputed trials, only narrowly beating out other contenders, because of its high quality and low price. This M9 has been equipped with a Tactical Light that can be blinding in close quarters.

pg18.name: G18
pg18.desc: Essentially an Automatic version of the G17C, the G18 was developed for the Austrian EKO Cobra counter-terrorist force. Classified as a Machine Pistol, the G18 has been equipped with a number of modifications to allow greater control over its very rapid fire. Regardless, the G18 in Automatic is incredibly difficult to fire effectively at anything other than extremely short ranges.

arF2.name: F2000
arF2.desc: A Belgian manufactured bullpup Assault Rifle configured in the Tactical setup with top and forward rails for mounting a variety of accessories. The rifle is in use with a variety of Special Forces units including Pakistani, Peruvian, Chilean, Indian and Polish. It has also been adapted as the standard rifle of Saudi Arabia and Slovenia. The bullpup configuration prevents it from mounting underslung weapons, but a high fire rate makes it lethal in CQB.

wLATJAV.name: FGM-148 JAVELIN
wLATJAV.desc: A shoulder launched AntiTank missile with both Direct and Top Attack modes. A Fire-and-Forget system requires a lock on before launch, but the missile will guide itself to the target.  When firing on Laser Designated targets the Javelin automatically uses Top Attack mode, which is exceptionally powerful against enemy armor.

smM5K.name: M5K
smM5K.desc: A tactical machine pistol based on one of the worldʹs most successful submachine gun designs. With the shoulder stock completely removed and the shortened receiver, this ultra compact personal defense weapon is capable of very high rates of fire, as well as great stopping power at close range.

pMP443L.name: MP443 TACT.
pMP443L.desc: Designed to replace the dated PMM pistol, the MP443 Grach pistol was developed in 1993 and fires high powered armor-piercing 9mm Russian rounds. The pistol is a combined construction of polymers and steel and has been adopted by select Special Forces units in the Russian military. This MP443 has been equipped with a Tactical Light that can be blinding in close quarters.

caHK53.name: G53
caHK53.desc: Compact assault rifle developed in Germany. Based on the famous G3 design.

wLAAFIM.name: FIM-92 STINGER
wLAAFIM.desc: The FIM-92 Stinger is a man portable infrared homing surface-to-air missile(SAM).  The Stinger is capable of locking on and engaging a large variety of craft, from small UAVs up to low flying helicopters and jets.  The Stinger requires a locked target in order to fire.

srM39.name: M39 EMR
srM39.desc: The M39 Enhanced Marksman Rifle (EMR) is a highly modernized M14 designed to be utilized by USMC designated marksmen. Issued with match-grade 7.62mm NATO long range ammunition the M39 is significantly lighter and more accurate than the original M14. The M39 is limited to Semi-Automatic fire, but supports a number of accessories including a standard Rifle Scope (8x).

sgM1014.name: M1014
sgM1014.desc: An Italian Semi-Automatic Shotgun, delivered to USMC in 1999, the M1014 fires 12 gauge rounds without the need for the pump action seen on the M870. A reliable and versatile weapon, the M1014 is also equipped with a rail for the mounting of various accessories and an open choke that results in wide pellet spread.

smPDR.name: PDW-R
smPDR.desc: Developed as a Personal Defense Weapon, the PDW-R differs from most other PDW concepts by utilizing the standard 5.56mm NATO rounds of the M16 or M4. This allows the PDW-R to share magazines and supply lines with standard troops while its short length and bullpup configuration allow the PDW-R to be easily operated in CQB. Though it lacks the accuracy of a rifle, the PDW-R has a greater punch at longer ranges than other PDWs.

wasK.name: ACB-90
wasK.desc: Advanced Combat Blade model 90 is a heavy duty combat blade with a razor sharp edge, partly serrated and complete with a gut hook at its tip. This premium piece of equipment allows for quick, clean, silent kills when approaching a target from behind and claiming the victimʹs Dogtags in the process. Slash attacks from the front can be lethal with multiple attacks, however they will not result in Dogtag trophies.

mgQBB95.name: QBB-95
mgQBB95.desc: Light machinegun designed in China and used by the PLA.

seqRad.name: RADIO BEACON
seqRad.desc: The AN-PRC-117F Radio allows the Recon soldier to deploy an additional Squad Spawn position. The Recon soldier must be part of a squad for this item to function.

waeM67.name: M67 GRENADE
waeM67.desc: A common defensive hand grenade, the M67 has a 3.5 second fuse and can be thrown approximately 30 meters by the average soldier. The lethal effect of this grenade is limited against targets with modern body armor.

wasRT.name: REPAIR TOOL
wasRT.desc: A hand held oxy-fuel welding and cutting torch provides the engineer with the ability to both Repair Friendly and Damage Enemy vehicles.

waeC4.name: C4 EXPLOSIVES
waeC4.desc: Remotely detonated Composition 4 explosive packs provide anti-material, anti-vehicle and anti-personnel abilities.

wasDef.name: DEFIBRILLATOR
wasDef.desc: Automated External Defibrillator (AED) allows an Assault soldier with proper medical training to revive a downed teammate within a short time after his apparent death.

seqUGS.name: T-UGS
seqUGS.desc: The Tactical Unattended Ground Sensor uses motion sensors to detect the presence of vehicles and infantry. The sensor emits an audible beep on detection and can be avoided by moving at low speed.

waeMine.name: M15 AT MINE
waeMine.desc: An Anti-Vehicle blast mine, the M15 was first used during the Korean War.  Armored vehicles traveling above a minimum speed will be disabled or destroyed by passing over the mine.

waeClay.name: M18 CLAYMORE
waeClay.desc: The M18A Claymore is a directional anti-personnel mine that is detonated by motion in front of the mine. The mine can be passed safely if the target is moving at low speeds.

seqEOD.name: EOD BOT
seqEOD.desc: A remotely controlled Explosive Ordinance Disposal robot allows the engineer to repair and damage vehicles like a normal repair tool, but can also arm and disarm explosives and MCOM stations in Rush.

seqSOF.name: SOFLAM
seqSOF.desc: The AN/PEQ-1 SOFLAM allows the Recon soldier to designate enemy vehicles for precision strikes. The SOFLAM is semi-autonomous and will designate targets even when unattended.

waeMort.name: M224 MORTAR
waeMort.desc: The M224 60mm Mortar is capable of firing High Explosive and Smoke rounds to provide suppressing fire and visual cover from indirect fire positions.

seqMAV.name: MAV
seqMAV.desc: A remotely operated Micro Air Vehicle equipped with a suite of Motion Sensors and a camera with IRNV capabilities for aerial reconnaissance.

martHIM.name: M142
martHIM.desc: Mobile rocket artillery used by US Marine Corps and Fire Brigade.

ifvBMP.name: BMP-2M
ifvBMP.desc: The BMP-2 is a second-generation, amphibious infantry fighting vehicle introduced in the 1980s in the Soviet Union.

trUH1.name: UH-1Y VENOM
trUH1.desc: Newest modern version of the “Twin Huey” helicopters used by the marines since the 70ʹs, this version built new and introduced in 2008.

trAAV.name: AAV-7A1 AMTRAC
trAAV.desc: The AAV-7A1 is the current amphibious troop transport of the United States Marine Corps

atTOW.name: M220 TOW LAUNCHER
atTOW.desc: TOW is a stationary anti-tank guided missile launcher, equipped with armor piercing missiles. The missile can be optically tracked or wired and weights from 3.9 to 5.9 kg. With a speed between 278-320 m/s this big boy can do some real damage to any armored vehicle roaming the battlefield.

vmaD.name: DROPSHIP
vmaD.desc: Heavily armored IFV and paratrooper transport plane

jfx1F35JSF.name: F-35
jfx1F35JSF.desc: Product of the JSF program, the F-35 Lightning is a stealth, multirole fighter with STOVL (Short Take Off Vertical Landing) capabilities.

ifvLAV.name: LAV-25
ifvLAV.desc: The LAV-25 is an eight-wheeled amphibious infantry fighting vehicle (IFV) used by the United States Marine Corps.

vmaG.name: GUNSHIP
vmaG.desc: Heavily armored ground-attack vehicle with mounted HMG and cannon.

mbtT90.name: T-90A
mbtT90.desc: The T-90 is derived from the T-72, and the most modern tank in service with the Russian Ground Forces and Naval Infantry.

aaLAV.name: LAV-AD
aaLAV.desc: The LAV-AD includes the Avenger anti-air system on a LAV-25 chassis.

mtdSPRUTSD.name: SPRUT-SD
mtdSPRUTSD.desc: Russian light and highly mobile tank destroyer based on the BMD-3 chassis.

ahMi28.name: MI-28 HAVOC
ahMi28.desc: The Mil Mi-28 (NATO reporting name ʹHavocʹ) is a Russian all-weather day-night two-seat anti-armor attack helicopter.

trhmvnxp5.name: HMMWV ASRAD
trhmvnxp5.desc: The ASRAD is a adaptation of the US HMMWV into an anti-aircraft role.

trDpv.name: DPV
trDpv.desc: Fast transport vehicle famously used by US Navy Seals during Desert Storm. While mostly replaced by HMMWVs, an improved design designated LSV is still used thanks to its superior speed and off-road capabilities.

aa9k22.name: 9K22 TUNGUSKA-M
aa9k22.desc: Mobile surface-to-air gun and missile system in service since 1982.  Developed in response to range shortcomings in the Zu-23 Shilka design.

trKLR.name: DIRTBIKE
trKLR.desc: The dirtbike is a fast and agile two seater motorycle.

ahAH1Z.name: AH-1Z VIPER
ahAH1Z.desc: The AH-1Z Viper (also called “SuperCobra“ or “Zulu Cobra”) is a twin-engine helicopter based on the AH-1W. USMC

trQB.name: QUAD BIKE
trQB.desc: Fast un-armored transport vehicle with 2 seats.

trVanM.name: RHINO
trVanM.desc: Modified van with remote turret and open passenger seats

mbtM1A.name: M1 ABRAMS
mbtM1A.desc: The M1 “Abrams” is the principal battle tank of the US Marine Corps.

trRIB.name: RHIB BOAT
trRIB.desc: This hybrid of a boat is a diverse and excellent vehicle for transport on the water. Mounted with a .50 cal gun in the front, itʹs not just a transport but also a fierce weapon for changing the tide of battle.

jaA10.name: A-10 THUNDERBOLT
jaA10.desc: Designed for a USAF requirement to provide CAS of ground forces by attacking ground targets with limited AA capability.

trKA60.name: KA-60 KASATKA
trKA60.desc: New utility helicopter from Kamov entering service with the Russian Air Force to replace the aging Mi-8.

trHmvM.name: PHOENIX
trHmvM.desc: Modified armored jeep with grenade launcher and HMG

martBM23.name: BM-23
martBM23.desc: Russian multiple rocket launch system mounted on a soviet truck.

saaPant.name: PANTSIR-S1
saaPant.desc: Russiaʹs SA-19/SA-N-11 (Tunguska) mobile AA artillery system parked on a stationary platform.

jfF18.name: F/A-18E SUPER HORNET
jfF18.desc: A multirole jet fighter aircraft introduced in 1983 and used today by the USMC. The C and D variants include upgraded avionics and weapons capability.

jaSU25.name: SU-25TM FROGFOOT
jaSU25.desc: Soviet CAS plane nicknamed “Grach”. NATO reporting name “Frogfoot”.

trHum.name: M1114 HMMWV
trHum.desc: Serving in every division of the US Armed Forces for 20 years, increased armor was added as a response to urban threats.

saaCRAM.name: CENTURION C-RAM
saaCRAM.desc: Land-based version of the Phalanx CIWS, deployed in Iraq to protect against missile and airborne attacks.

shz11.name: Z-11W
shz11.desc: Armed military version of the Z-11 Chinese light utility helicopter.

sKorn.name: 9M133 KORNET LAUNCHER
sKorn.desc: The ʹKornetʹ is a Russian anti-tank guided missile, whos purpose is to rip holes on main battle tanks and similiar vehicles, but also engage in slow and lowflying helicopters. It uses a reliable and simple to use system with a laser beam guidance.

trITV.name: GROWLER ITV
trITV.desc: Used by the USMC starting in 2009, the Growler is the only transport vehicle that fits in the V-22 Osprey.

trVodnM.name: BARSUK
trVodnM.desc: Modified armored jeep with grenade launcher and HMG

jfSu35.name: SU-35BM FLANKER-E
jfSu35.desc: A long range multi-role fighter, modernized and deployed starting in 2011. The last of the “Flanker” series by Sukhoi.

mtdM1128.name: M1128
mtdM1128.desc: The M1128 is a eight-wheeled tank destroyer used by USA and Canada.

trVodnxp5.name: VODNIK AA
trVodnxp5.desc: The Vodnik AA is an adaptation of the Russian Vodnik into an anti-aircraft role.

ifvBTR90.name: BTR-90
ifvBTR90.desc: Russian, wheeled, armored personnel carrier. Bigger and better equipped than its predecessor, the BTR-90 can withstand the impact of 14.5mm projectiles.

shAH6.name: AH-6J LITTLE BIRD
shAH6.desc: Improved attack version of the MH-6.

unlocks.desc: Reactive armor panels and/or slats absorb the impact from anti-tank weapons, protecting you from damage but becoming destroyed in the process.

unlocks.name: IR FLARES
unlocks.desc: Infrared flare launchers that when launched will distract incoming missiles and cause them to miss their locked target.

unlocks.name: HEAT SEEKERS
unlocks.desc: Heatseeking missiles launched by the pilot which lock on to and track enemy aircraft.

unlocks.name: STEALTH
unlocks.desc: Engine tuning and fuselage coating materials disguise your vehicleʹs infrared signature, increasing enemy locking and tracking difficulty and decreasing the time you are revealed to the enemy from being spotted.

unlocks.name: BELT SPEED

unlocks.name: PROXIMITY SCAN

unlocks.name: ROCKET PODS
unlocks.desc: A set of unguided FFAR Rocket Pods mounted under the wings.

unlocks.name: AIR RADAR

unlocks.name: BELOW RADAR
unlocks.desc: When flying at low altitudes your heat signature is decreased, hiding you from enemy radar and preventing enemy air-to-air missile systems from locking on to you.

unlocks.name: EXTINGUISHER

unlocks.name: BEAM SCANNING

unlocks.name: ECM JAMMER
unlocks.desc: Electronic countermeasures including chaff launchers and deceptive transmitters disrupt enemy missile tracking and targeting systems for a short time when activated.

unlocks.name: TOW
unlocks.desc: Optically-tracked wire-guided anti-tank missile.

unlocks.name: CANNON HE
unlocks.desc: High Explosive shell for Tank destroyers

unlocks.name: EXTINGUISHER
unlocks.desc: Returns a disabled vehicle to normal operation.

unlocks.name: IR SMOKE
unlocks.desc: Smoke grenades enhanced with metal filaments that when launched remove laser-designation, spoof incoming guided missiles, and prevent enemies from revealing your position to teammates.

unlocks.name: COAXIAL LMG
unlocks.desc: A light machinegun mounted coaxially to your main weapon.

unlocks.name: AUTOLOADER
unlocks.desc: An enhanced mechanism decreases the minimum time between firing rounds in your main weapon.

unlocks.name: ZOOM OPTICS
unlocks.desc: A secondary weapon sight with up to 3x magnification.

unlocks.name: GUIDED SHELL
unlocks.desc: A Smart Target-Activated Fire and Forget shell that can lock on to and track enemy land vehicles and can acquire laser-designated targets even if they are out of line-of-sight.

unlocks.name: THERMAL OPTICS
unlocks.desc: A secondary weapon sight with thermal optics that highlights soldiers and vehicles for efficient target identification.

unlocks.name: THERMAL CAMO
unlocks.desc: Anti-reflective coating on your vehicle increases enemy locking and tracking difficulty and decreases the time you are revealed to the enemy from being spotted.  This is active while in any seat of the vehicle.

unlocks.name: CANISTER SHELL
unlocks.desc: A tank shell encasing thousands of tungsten balls fired though the cannon muzzle like a shotgun.

unlocks.name: REACTIVE ARMOR
unlocks.desc: Reactive armor panels and/or slats absorb the impact from anti-tank weapons, protecting you from damage but becoming destroyed in the process.

unlocks.name: AIR-BURST MISSILE

unlocks.name: ANTI-AIR MISSILE
unlocks.desc: Anti-aircraft missile capabilities are added which will lock on to and track enemy air vehicles.

unlocks.name: IR SMOKE

unlocks.name: AUTOLOADER

unlocks.name: ATACMS Missile
unlocks.desc: A Smart Target-Activated Fire and Forget shell that can lock on to and track enemy land vehicles and can acquire laser-designated targets even if they are out of line-of-sight.

unlocks.name: MAINTENANCE

unlocks.name: ZOOM OPTICS
unlocks.desc: A secondary weapon sight with up to 3x magnification.

unlocks.name: THERMAL CAMO
unlocks.desc: Anti-reflective coating on your vehicle increases enemy locking and tracking difficulty and decreases the time you are revealed to the enemy from being spotted.  This is active while in any seat of the vehicle.

unlocks.name: TOW
unlocks.desc: Optically-tracked wire-guided anti-tank missile.

unlocks.name: PROXIMITY DEFENSE
unlocks.desc: Deploys an incendiary smoke that gives damage to players within the proximity.

unlocks.name: L85A2
unlocks.desc: Part of the SA80 family, the L85 is the standard assault rifle of the British armed forces.

unlocks.name: FAMAS
unlocks.desc: Standard service rifle of the French military.

unlocks.name: SCAR-L
unlocks.desc: The SCAR rifle systemʹs modularity allows for many different configurations. The Mk. 16 “SCAR-L” features a 14 inch barrel as well as a full 30 round magazine. Compared to its 20 round carbine counterpart, the heavier Mk. 17, the SCAR-L provides greater target acquisition at longer ranges due to the extended barrel length as well as more controlled fire due to manageable recoil.

unlocks.name: AUG A3
unlocks.desc: This 5.56 bullpup design was developed in the 1970s and features high modularity while being fully ambidextrous. Since its adoption as the standard rifle of the Austrian army in 1977, it has seen great success as an export, with a high number of global users praising its ruggedness and excellent handling.

unlocks.name: M26 FRAG
unlocks.desc: The M26 Lightweight Shotgun System was developed to replace older, more cumbersome breaching shotguns.  Available as a standalone shotgun, or capable of being mounted on some Assault Rifles with Underslung Rails, the M26 is able to fire Shot, Flechette, Frag, and Slug rounds.

unlocks.name: M320 BUCK
unlocks.desc: A single shot 40mm Grenade Launcher, the M320 replaced the old M203 in service with the US Military.  Initially developed for the G36 assault rifle, the M320 allows a larger variety of ammunition to be used with the weapon including Fragmentation, Flechette, Smoke rounds and Low Velocity Grenades. The M320 can be equipped on some Assault Rifles with the Underslung Rail.

unlocks.name: M320 SMOKE
unlocks.desc: A close range 40mm buck shot, for those close quarters.

unlocks.name: M26 DART
unlocks.desc: The M26 Lightweight Shotgun System was developed to replace older, more cumbersome breaching shotguns.  Available as a standalone shotgun, or capable of being mounted on some Assault Rifles with Underslung Rails, the M26 is able to fire Shot, Flechette, Frag, and Slug rounds.

unlocks.name: ASSAULT: M320 LVG
unlocks.desc: A close range 40mm buck shot, for those close quarters.

unlocks.name: ASSAULT: M26 SLUG
unlocks.desc: The M26 Lightweight Shotgun System was developed to replace older, more cumbersome breaching shotguns.  Available as a standalone shotgun, or capable of being mounted on some Assault Rifles with Underslung Rails, the M26 is able to fire Shot, Flechette, Frag, and Slug rounds.

unlocks.name: DEFIBRILLATOR
unlocks.desc: Automated External Defibrillator (AED) allows an Assault soldier with proper medical training to revive a downed teammate within a short time after his apparent death.

unlocks.name: M320
unlocks.desc: A single shot 40mm Grenade Launcher, the M320 replaced the old M203 in service with the US Military.  Initially developed for the G36 assault rifle, the M320 allows a larger variety of ammunition to be used with the weapon including Fragmentation, Flechette, Smoke rounds and Low Velocity Grenades. The M320 can be equipped on some Assault Rifles with the Underslung Rail.

unlocks.name: KH2002
unlocks.desc: This Iranian developed Assault Rifle is essentially a bullpup conversion of the M16. The KH2002 is intended to replace the G3 in service with the Iranian armed forces, though there is speculation that it may be years before the rifle is ready for full deployment. The KH2002ʹs short length lends itself well to close combat, but prevents it from mounting any underslung weapons.

unlocks.name: M416
unlocks.desc: The M416 was developed by a famous German weapons manufacturer as a more reliable version of the classic M16. The weapon is essentially a fusion of the M16 and the G36 Assault Rifles. The M416 is reliable and accurate, with a moderate recoil and rate of fire that makes for an effective all around weapon.

unlocks.name: M26 MASS
unlocks.desc: The M26 Lightweight Shotgun System was developed to replace older, more cumbersome breaching shotguns.  Available as a standalone shotgun, or capable of being mounted on some Assault Rifles with Underslung Rails, the M26 is able to fire Shot, Flechette, Frag, and Slug rounds.

unlocks.name: AEK-971
unlocks.desc: The AEK-971 was developed as a possible successor to the AK-74 series of Assault Rifles and features a unique recoil reduction system. The AEK-971ʹs high rate of fire makes it excellent in close quarters but difficult to control. Shooters should switch to Semi-Automatic or 3 Round Burst for longer ranges.

unlocks.name: M16A4
unlocks.desc: This 4th generation M16A4 is equipped with a removable carrying handle, a RIS (Rail Interface System) for mounting accessories, and is capable of both 3 Round Burst and Semi-Automatic fire. The original flaws of the M16 design have all but been eliminated and the M16A4 serves as the standard rifle of the USMC. Low recoil with a high rate of fire, the M16A4 is an accurate medium range weapon.

unlocks.name: F2000
unlocks.desc: A Belgian manufactured bullpup Assault Rifle configured in the Tactical setup with top and forward rails for mounting a variety of accessories. The rifle is in use with a variety of Special Forces units including Pakistani, Peruvian, Chilean, Indian and Polish. It has also been adapted as the standard rifle of Saudi Arabia and Slovenia. The bullpup configuration prevents it from mounting underslung weapons, but a high fire rate makes it lethal in CQB.

unlocks.name: G3A3
unlocks.desc: The G3 rifle is one of the most widely fielded Assault Rifles in the world. Multiple versions of the G3 exist, and it has been used in countries around the world, including Sweden where it was known as the AK4. This particular G3 is the A3 variant, with a fixed stock. The long barrel and firing heavy 7.62x51mm NATO round enable the G3A3 to reach out at longer ranges than most other Assault Rifles, but at the cost of heavy recoil.

unlocks.name: AN-94
unlocks.desc: In service with elite Russian forces, the AN-94 offers a unique, highly accurate, 2 round burst feature. Compared to the standard AK series, the AN-94 requires a significantly higher degree of training. A skilled shooter can effectively engage targets at a longer range than typical Assault Rifles.

unlocks.name: AK-74M
unlocks.desc: The AK-74M is the latest Modernized version of the classic AK-47. Fielded as the standard Assault Rifle by the Russian Army, the M variant includes a side folding polymer stock and a scope mount rail on the left side of the weapon. Recent developments allow the AK series of weapons to field many of the accessories typically seen on Western guns. The AK-74M is a reliable and rugged medium range weapon.

unlocks.name: M16A3
unlocks.desc: The 3rd generation of M16A3 has been upgraded with a RIS (Rail Interface System) for mounting accessories and is capable of Automatic and Semi-Automatic fire. Available to front line units engaged in urban combat, the M16A3ʹs low recoil makes a capable all around weapon.

unlocks.name: QBZ-95B
unlocks.desc: Standard service rifle of the Chinese armed forces.

unlocks.name: G53
unlocks.desc: Compact assault rifle developed in Germany. Based on the famous G3 design.

unlocks.name: MTAR-21
unlocks.desc: This bullpup carbine is the ultra-compact version of the Israeli army standard TAR-21 rifle. It features supreme ergonomics and handling due to its 590 mm (23.2 in) length and is intended for use in tighter environments where standard length rifles become cumbersome. As of 2009, it is destined to become the standard rifle of the IDF, and is also seeing success internationally as part of security and police forces.

unlocks.name: ACW-R
unlocks.desc: This adaptive combat rifle features a number of recent rifle designs and acts as a lightweight, feature heavy, rifle platform. Using the modern, recoil-reducing “Grendel” round, as well as being built to endure rough weather conditions and capable of utilizing standard STANAG magazines, this rifle is equipped to fill many of the roles required by both military and law enforcement uses.

unlocks.name: SA-18 IGLA
unlocks.desc: Russian man-portable infrared homing SAM. Labeled the 9K38 by the Russians and SA-18 IGLA by the US, the IGLA is capable of engaging a wide range of threats from UAV sized aircraft up to helicopters and low flying jets.  The IGLA requires a locked target in order to fire.

unlocks.name: FIM-92 STINGER
unlocks.desc: The FIM-92 Stinger is a man portable infrared homing surface-to-air missile(SAM).  The Stinger is capable of locking on and engaging a large variety of craft, from small UAVs up to low flying helicopters and jets.  The Stinger requires a locked target in order to fire.

unlocks.name: M15 AT MINE
unlocks.desc: An Anti-Vehicle blast mine, the M15 was first used during the Korean War.  Armored vehicles traveling above a minimum speed will be disabled or destroyed by passing over the mine.

unlocks.name: SCAR-H
unlocks.desc: Developed for the US SOCOM, the SCAR is a modular series of weapons available in multiple interchangeable calibers, barrel lengths, and configurations. This particular model has been configured as a SCAR-H CQB (SCAR-Heavy Close Quarters Battle) with a shortened barrel and chambered for the hard hitting 7.62mm NATO round. This gives the SCAR-H a greater range than typical Carbines at the expense of serious recoil.

unlocks.name: EOD BOT
unlocks.desc: A remotely controlled Explosive Ordinance Disposal robot allows the engineer to repair and damage vehicles like a normal repair tool, but can also arm and disarm explosives and MCOM stations in Rush.

unlocks.name: M4
unlocks.desc: Visually and mechanically similar to the M16, the M4 Carbine was developed to replace pistols and sub-machine guns at the front lines. The M4 is capable Semi-Automatic and 3 Round Burst fire and is equipped with accessory rails for end user customization. The rifle has largely replaced the M16A2 previously in use by the US Marine Corps.

unlocks.name: A-91
unlocks.desc: An unusual weapon, even by Russian standards, the A-91 is a bullpup Carbine chambered in the 5.56mm NATO round instead of a Russian caliber. Made from polymers, it features a forward shell ejection system that keeps shells well clear of the shooterʹs face upon ejection. The bullpup configuration prevents the A-91 from mounting a foregrip.

unlocks.name: FGM-148 JAVELIN
unlocks.desc: A shoulder launched AntiTank missile with both Direct and Top Attack modes. A Fire-and-Forget system requires a lock on before launch, but the missile will guide itself to the target.  When firing on Laser Designated targets the Javelin automatically uses Top Attack mode, which is exceptionally powerful against enemy armor.

unlocks.name: G36C
unlocks.desc: A cut down version of the German Armyʹs full size G36 rifle, the C in G36C is stands for Commando or Compact. Equipped with a number of rails for accessories and a set of backup iron sights instead of the integrated optics and carry handle of the G36, the G36C is a Carbine with significant customization options. Its great ergonomics and short length make it excellent in short range encounters. The G36C also includes a 2 Round Burst mode.

unlocks.name: SG553
unlocks.desc: A Carbine variant of the Swiss Armyʹs standard SG550 rifle, the SG553 improves over its predecessor the well-known SG552 by including integrated rails for mounting accessories. A Carbine with excellent ergonomics, the SG553 is capable of Automatic, 3 Round Burst, and Semi-Automatic fire and is an excellent close range weapon.

unlocks.name: AKS-74u
unlocks.desc: Derived from the AKS-74, the AKS-74u is a shortened Carbine with the power of a rifle cartridge but the size of a submachine gun. Often called by its nickname “Krinkov” the shortened barrel makes the weapon inaccurate at medium ranges but extremely effective in close quarters. Due to its incredibly short length the AKS-74U cannot mount a bipod.

unlocks.name: M4A1
unlocks.desc: Essentially a shortened version of the M16 the M4A1 Carbine traces its roots to weapons designed for US Special Operations Command (SOCOM) during the Vietnam War. The M4A1 variant is capable of Automatic fire and includes rails that allow the user to equip a large number of accessories. The carbine has seen heavy use at the frontlines of Iraq and Afghanistan in close quarters and urban environments.

unlocks.name: SKS
unlocks.desc: Millions of SKS rifles were produced originally for the Soviet Army in 1945 and in China as the Type 56. The SKS is a popular rifle with civilian shooters, and can still be found in a number of arsenals around the world. A number of aftermarket upgrades are available for the SKS, this model is equipped with a synthetic stock, detachable 30 round magazine, and a PKS-07 (7x) scope.

unlocks.name: L96
unlocks.desc: British made, high performance sniper rifle. Widely used across Europe.

unlocks.name: QBU-88
unlocks.desc: Semi-automatic sniper rifle of Chinese design

unlocks.name: JNG-90
unlocks.desc: Easily identified by its massive muzzle break, the JNG-90 serves as the standard sniper rifle of the Turkish army. This modern rifle has integral rail systems and many other accessory options, making it adaptable to shifting situations. It provides the shooter great stopping power, as well as sub MOA accuracy.

unlocks.name: M417
unlocks.desc: This bigger brother of M416 features a heavier 16 inch barrel as well as an enlarged receiver capable of handling the heavy 7.62 round. The high precision and stopping power of this rifle makes it ideal as a DMR, and it sees service in many armed forces worldwide.

unlocks.name: T-UGS
unlocks.desc: The Tactical Unattended Ground Sensor uses motion sensors to detect the presence of vehicles and infantry. The sensor emits an audible beep on detection and can be avoided by moving at low speed.

unlocks.name: SV98
unlocks.desc: Similar to its Western counter parts, the SV-98 began life as a proven Bolt-Action sporting rifle. The SV-98 is equipped with a 10 round detachable box magazine, a muzzle brake that can be swapped for a suppressor, and backup iron sights. The SV-98 is standardly equipped with a PKS-07 (7x) for very long range shooting.

unlocks.name: SOFLAM
unlocks.desc: The AN/PEQ-1 SOFLAM allows the Recon soldier to designate enemy vehicles for precision strikes. The SOFLAM is semi-autonomous and will designate targets even when unattended.

unlocks.name: MAV
unlocks.desc: A remotely operated Micro Air Vehicle equipped with a suite of Motion Sensors and a camera with IRNV capabilities for aerial reconnaissance.

unlocks.name: M39 EMR
unlocks.desc: The M39 Enhanced Marksman Rifle (EMR) is a highly modernized M14 designed to be utilized by USMC designated marksmen. Issued with match-grade 7.62mm NATO long range ammunition the M39 is significantly lighter and more accurate than the original M14. The M39 is limited to Semi-Automatic fire, but supports a number of accessories including a standard Rifle Scope (8x).

unlocks.name: M40A5
unlocks.desc: Developed around the Bolt-Action of a proven American hunting rifle, the M40A5 has been upgraded with a lightened fiberglass stock, a detachable magazine, and the provisions for mounting suppressors. An incredibly accurate rifle, the M40A5 currently serves as the primary Sniper Rifle for the USMC. The M40A5 is by default equipped with a Rifle Scope (8x).

unlocks.name: M98B
unlocks.desc: A precision tactical rifle, the M98B was uniquely developed from the ground up as a Bolt-Action Sniper Rifle. Firing the .338 Magnum round from a detachable box magazine the M98B is capable of impressive accuracy and great stopping power even at extreme ranges. The M98B is currently being evaluated by US SOCOM in a modified form. The M98B is equipped with a Rifle Scope (8x).

unlocks.name: MK11 MOD 0
unlocks.desc: Essentially an M16 chambered for the heavy 7.62mm NATO caliber the Mk 11 Mod 0 features a longer, heavier, free-floating barrel, enhanced rail system and provisions to mount a sound suppressor. Everything about the Mk 11 Mod 0 is designed to enhance accuracy and provide a squad long range, accurate, Semi-Automatic fire. The Mk 11 Mod 0 is equipped with a Rifle Scope (8x) by default.

unlocks.name: SVD
unlocks.desc: Designed as a squad support weapon, the SVD Dragunov enhances a squadʹs ability by providing long range, rapid, accurate Semi-Automatic fire. Although the SVD looks similar to an AK style weapon, these are merely cosmetic. When paired with specially designed sniper cartridges the SVD Dragunov is a deadly and accurate marksman weapon. The SVD is equipped with a standard PKS-07 (7x) scope.

unlocks.name: TYPE 88 LMG
unlocks.desc: A Chinese General Purpose Machine Gun the TYPE-88 is also known by its Chinese designation QJY-88. Despite the TYPE-88 name (referring to 1988 as the year of adoption) the weapon has only recently entered wide service with the Peopleʹs Liberation Army. The TYPE-88 fires a special heavy version of the Chinese 5.8x42mm round and is equipped by default with a bipod for supported shooting.

unlocks.name: MG36
unlocks.desc: Machine gun version of the German G36. This MG model is no longer in production.

unlocks.name: QBB-95
unlocks.desc: Light machinegun designed in China and used by the PLA.

unlocks.name: LSAT
unlocks.desc: This US JSSAP prototype is intended to significantly reduce the weight associated with small arms and their ammunition. Using a High Ignition Temperature Propellant, this prototype light machine gun features belt fed caseless ammunition. Should the program be successful, this weapon system could become a great improvement over the heavier and more cumbersome squad automatic weapons currently in use.

unlocks.name: L86A2
unlocks.desc: Designed to provide fire support to smaller groups of infantry, this British SA80 family rifle comes equipped with an extended barrel giving great effective range. While originally intended to act as a light machine gun, it has seen a shift towards marksman duties due to its great performance at longer distances. While it has limited sustained fire capabilities due to not being belt fed, the reliable accuracy makes it a great force multiplier for any squad.

unlocks.name: C4 EXPLOSIVES
unlocks.desc: Remotely detonated Composition 4 explosive packs provide anti-material, anti-vehicle and anti-personnel abilities.

unlocks.name: M249
unlocks.desc: An adapted version of the Belgian original, the M249 was modified to conform to the United Statesʹ design requirements. The M249 has seen action in every major conflict since the 1989 invasion of Panama and has earned a reputation as a reliable weapon. A single M249 can supply suppressive fire equivalent to 15 riflemen. The M249 comes equipped by default with a Bipod for supported shooting.

unlocks.name: M18 CLAYMORE
unlocks.desc: The M18A Claymore is a directional anti-personnel mine that is detonated by motion in front of the mine. The mine can be passed safely if the target is moving at low speeds.

unlocks.name: M224 MORTAR
unlocks.desc: The M224 60mm Mortar is capable of firing High Explosive and Smoke rounds to provide suppressing fire and visual cover from indirect fire positions.

unlocks.name: PKP PECHENEG
unlocks.desc: Another Modernization of a traditional Russian weapon, the PKP Pecheneg replaces the PKM machine gun in service with Spetsnaz units. Firing a heavier round than the RPK-74M the Pecheneg is able to supply greater suppressive fire thanks to its increased power and belt feed. The Pecheneg comes equipped by default with a bipod for supported shooting.

unlocks.name: M240B
unlocks.desc: The M240 is a General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG) that was first developed in Belgium and adopted by the USMC in 1991. The M60 was replaced first by the M240G, and subsequently by the M240B which provides commonality between the Marines and the US Army. Firing the heavier 7.62mm NATO round the M240B has greater power than the M249. The M240 is equipped with a bipod by default for supported shooting.

unlocks.name: M60E4
unlocks.desc: “The Pig,” as it was commonly referred to when it was introduced in Vietnam, has served with every branch of the US Military and continues to serve with Special Forces groups. All though the M60 has been mostly replaced by the M240, the upgraded M60E4 features modern accessory rails, a shortened barrel, and improved reliability, and reduced weight. The M60E4 features a bipod standard for supported shooting.

unlocks.name: RPK-74M
unlocks.desc: The RPK-74M is an improved version of the original RPK developed in the 1950s. Essentially a heavy barreled AK-74, the RPK fires from a longer magazine and has been equipped with polymer grips to lighten the weapon. The RPK-74M also features the same scope mount as the AK-74M and is equipped with a bipod by default for supported shooting.

unlocks.name: M27 IAR
unlocks.desc: This beefed up M416 entered service alongside the M249 in the Marine Corps in 2011. The M27 Infantry Automatic Rifle (IAR) features a heavier, longer barrel and an extended magazine to enable greater amounts of suppressive fire while retaining some of the mobility of a standard M416. The M27 features a bipod by default for supported shooting.

unlocks.name: M1911 SUPP.
unlocks.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces. This M1911 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

unlocks.name: ACB-90
unlocks.desc: Advanced Combat Blade model 90 is a heavy duty combat blade with a razor sharp edge, partly serrated and complete with a gut hook at its tip. This premium piece of equipment allows for quick, clean, silent kills when approaching a target from behind and claiming the victimʹs Dogtags in the process. Slash attacks from the front can be lethal with multiple attacks, however they will not result in Dogtag trophies.

unlocks.name: DAO-12
unlocks.desc: A Battlefield 2 classic, originally developed in South Africa, the DAO-12 is essentially the combination of a revolver and a Shotgun. The fixed drum magazine is made of individual chambers, each holding a single round, which are fired only when placed in line with the barrel. A spring winding mechanism makes reloading an empty weapon a time consuming process and the short barrel results in a wide pellet spread.

unlocks.name: M1911 TACT.
unlocks.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces. This M1911 has been equipped with a Tactical Light that can be blinding in close quarters.

unlocks.name: M1911
unlocks.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces.

unlocks.name: M5K
unlocks.desc: A tactical machine pistol based on one of the worldʹs most successful submachine gun designs. With the shoulder stock completely removed and the shortened receiver, this ultra compact personal defense weapon is capable of very high rates of fire, as well as great stopping power at close range.

unlocks.name: SPAS-12
unlocks.desc: This Italian made iconic shotgun has seen great success since its introduction on the market during the 1980s. Itʹs become popular world wide thanks to its capacity to handle a great variety  of shell types. Its unique magazine design further simplifies the use of varied ammunition, allowing the SPAS-12 to remain in high regard with police and military units worldwide.

unlocks.name: PP-19
unlocks.desc: Submachine gun developed in Russia, featuring a helical high capacity magazine.

unlocks.name: MK3A1
unlocks.desc: Fully automatic shotgun prototype developed in the US.

unlocks.name: M1911 S-TAC
unlocks.desc: The M1911 is one of the most popular pistols in the world. Adopted in 1911 for the US armed forces, the M1911 served as the primary side arm through to 1985. Many clones and copies of the M1911 exist, and the internal action is used in nearly all modern pistols. Modernized and updated versions of the M1911 is still in use by MEU(SOC) US Marine Corps Special Forces. This M1911 has been equipped with a Tactical Light and a Suppressor.

unlocks.name: 870MCS
unlocks.desc: The M870 is an American made Pump-Action Shotgun that has been used by Special Forces units for decades. In urban environments the M870 is especially effective due to its high stopping power at close range. The ability to load different types of shells makes the M870 able to adapt to a wide variety of situations, while a narrow choke gives the M870 slightly more range than other shotguns.

unlocks.name: XBOW SCOPED
unlocks.desc: The Xbow fires a variety of different bolts.

unlocks.name: XBOW
unlocks.desc: The Xbow fires a variety of different bolts.

unlocks.name: G17C
unlocks.desc: The G17C pistol is part of a large series of pistols from an Austrian manufacturer. Chambered in 9mm, this full sized combat pistol features a polymer frame and anti-corrosion surfaces that make it incredibly reliable. The G17C is incredibly popular with both Police and Military units worldwide. This G17C has been equipped with an integral Laser Sight that makes unaimed fire more accurate.

unlocks.name: PP-2000
unlocks.desc: Though chambered in the standard 9x19mm caliber, the PP-2000 is designed to use Russian overpressure rounds at high velocity to penetrate body armor. The high muzzle velocity of the PP-2000 gives it a flatter trajectory than other 9mm weapons, and its compact size make it ideal as a Personal Defense Weapon. When equipped with the 40 round extended magazine the PP-2000 also functions admirably in a CQB assault role.

unlocks.name: M9 TACT.
unlocks.desc: Formally known as Pistol, Semiautomatic, 9mm, M9, the M9 was selected as the primary sidearm of the entire United States military in 1985. Developed in Italy, the M9 was selected in a series of often disputed trials, only narrowly beating out other contenders, because of its high quality and low price. This M9 has been equipped with a Tactical Light that can be blinding in close quarters.

unlocks.name: MP443 TACT.
unlocks.desc: Designed to replace the dated PMM pistol, the MP443 Grach pistol was developed in 1993 and fires high powered armor-piercing 9mm Russian rounds. The pistol is a combined construction of polymers and steel and has been adopted by select Special Forces units in the Russian military. This MP443 has been equipped with a Tactical Light that can be blinding in close quarters.

unlocks.name: UMP-45
unlocks.desc: German built, the UMP-45 is a fully automatic Personal Defense Weapon noted for its versatility and optimal mobility. Essentially an improved version of the MP5, the UMP-45 is functionally similar but substantially cheaper to manufacture and includes several modern upgrades such as the top and forward accessory rail. The UMP-45 is well-rounded and capable as a Personal Defense Weapon.

unlocks.name: G17C SUPP.
unlocks.desc: The G17C pistol is part of a large series of pistols from an Austrian manufacturer. Chambered in 9mm, this full sized combat pistol features a polymer frame and anti-corrosion surfaces that make it incredibly reliable. The G17C is incredibly popular with both Police and Military units worldwide. This G17C has been equipped with an integral Laser Sight that makes unaimed fire more accurate and a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

unlocks.name: M1014
unlocks.desc: An Italian Semi-Automatic Shotgun, delivered to USMC in 1999, the M1014 fires 12 gauge rounds without the need for the pump action seen on the M870. A reliable and versatile weapon, the M1014 is also equipped with a rail for the mounting of various accessories and an open choke that results in wide pellet spread.

unlocks.name: M9 SUPP.
unlocks.desc: Formally known as Pistol, Semiautomatic, 9mm, M9, the M9 was selected as the primary sidearm of the entire United States military in 1985. Developed in Italy, the M9 was selected in a series of often disputed trials, only narrowly beating out other contenders, because of its high quality and low price. This M9 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

unlocks.name: MP443 SUPP.
unlocks.desc: Designed to replace the dated PMM pistol, the MP443 Grach pistol was developed in 1993 and fires high powered armor-piercing 9mm Russian rounds. The pistol is a combined construction of polymers and steel and has been adopted by select Special Forces units in the Russian military. This MP443 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

unlocks.name: G18
unlocks.desc: Essentially an Automatic version of the G17C, the G18 was developed for the Austrian EKO Cobra counter-terrorist force. Classified as a Machine Pistol, the G18 has been equipped with a number of modifications to allow greater control over its very rapid fire. Regardless, the G18 in Automatic is incredibly difficult to fire effectively at anything other than extremely short ranges.

unlocks.name: PDW-R
unlocks.desc: Developed as a Personal Defense Weapon, the PDW-R differs from most other PDW concepts by utilizing the standard 5.56mm NATO rounds of the M16 or M4. This allows the PDW-R to share magazines and supply lines with standard troops while its short length and bullpup configuration allow the PDW-R to be easily operated in CQB. Though it lacks the accuracy of a rifle, the PDW-R has a greater punch at longer ranges than other PDWs.

unlocks.name: SAIGA 12K
unlocks.desc: This Russian made magazine fed 12 gauge Shotgun is based on the proven AK-47 action and equipped with a folding stock. It is reliable, fast to reload, and capable of mounting a variety of accessories. The Saiga 12K is popular with Russian police and security services, and it is an effective close combat weapon with a wide pellet spread.

unlocks.name: .44 MAGNUM
unlocks.desc: A .44 Magnum, the most powerful handgun in the world, this particular model features a ported barrel, a compact frame for easy carry, and of course, a round that will blow your head clean off. The .44 Magnum is the most powerful available side arm, but the recoil and weight of the weapon makes fast follow up shots extremely difficult.

unlocks.name: P90
unlocks.desc: Developed in Belgium as a Personal Defense Weapon for vehicle crews, Special Forces and Counter-Terrorist groups the P90 is a compact and capable weapon system. The three forward rails allow an operator to mount a wide variety accessories and the 5.7x28mm special armor piercing ammunition is fired at nearly rifle velocity. Standard with a 50 round magazine the P90 is capable as an offensive CQB weapon for highly mobile personnel.

unlocks.name: G18 SUPP.
unlocks.desc: Essentially an Automatic version of the G17C, the G18 was developed for the Austrian EKO Cobra counter-terrorist force. Classified as a Machine Pistol, the G18 has been equipped with a number of modifications to allow greater control over its very rapid fire. Regardless, the G18 in Automatic is incredibly difficult to fire effectively at anything other than extremely short ranges. This G18 has been equipped with a Suppressor to lower the flash and sound signature.

unlocks.name: USAS-12
unlocks.desc: A South Korean produced Automatic Shotgun, the USAS-12 was specifically developed for the combat Shotgun role. Feeding from a box magazine, and capable of both Automatic and Semi-Automatic fire, the USAS-12ʹs high weight makes recoil manageable. The open choke results in a wide pellet spread.

unlocks.name: .44 SCOPED
unlocks.desc: A .44 Magnum, the most powerful handgun in the world, this particular model features a ported barrel, a compact frame for easy carry, and of course, a round that will blow your head clean off. The .44 Magnum is the most powerful available side arm, but the recoil and weight of the weapon makes fast follow up shots extremely difficult. This .44Magnum is equipped with a 3x scope.

unlocks.name: AS VAL
unlocks.desc: The AS VAL is an integrally suppressed Soviet designed Assault Rifle developed for use in the Spetsnaz. Chambered for a special high performance armor piercing 9x39mm round, the AS VAL includes mounts for using optical, red dot or even night vision scopes. The VAL is designed to be fired only with the suppressor attached, and therefore prevents the rifle from mounting underslung attachments.

unlocks.name: MP412 REX
unlocks.desc: Developed for export in Russia (REX stands for Revolver for Export), the MP412 is a compact .357 Magnum handgun with an interesting tilt open and auto extraction design. While not as powerful as the .44 Magnum, the .357 Magnum round from the MP412 offers excellent stopping power and the compact package offers a slightly higher rate of accurate fire.

unlocks.name: MP7
unlocks.desc: Another contender for the newly developing PDW market the MP7 is currently in service with the German Bundeswehr and the Norwegian Armed Forces. The MP7A1 includes an improved stock, additional safeties, and added rails for mounting lights, lasers, and sights. The weapon is also capable of being suppressed, giving it excellent close combat stealth performance.

unlocks.name: 93R
unlocks.desc: A modified version of the M9 pistol, the 93R is able to fire in 3 Round Bursts. The 93R is equipped with a forward folding fore grip and an extended barrel which is ported to reduce recoil. Trained shooters are able to fire busts in rapid succession, and the pistol is typically seen in service only with elite special purpose units.
